quote: I hope I have helped to raise the profile of science and to show that physics is not a mystery but can be understood by ordinary people.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: Physics isn't the most important thing. Love is.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: Physics is like sex: sure, it may give some practical results, but that's not why we do it.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: The only thing that interests the physicist is finding out on what assumptions a framework of things can be constructed which will enable us to know how to use them mechanically. Physics, as I have said on another occasion, is the technique of techniques and the ars combinatoria for fabricating machines. It is a knowledge which has scarcely anything to do with comprehension.
author: José Ortega y Gasset

quote: What I am going to tell you about is what we teach our physics students in the third or fourth year of graduate school... It is my task to convince you not to turn away because you don't understand it. You see my physics students don't understand it... That is because I don't understand it. Nobody does.
author: Richard Feynman,  QED: The Strange Theory of Light and Matter

quote: When you read about chemistry and physics, you want to do them too.
author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Have Space Suit—Will Travel

quote: ...quantum mechanics—the physics of our world—requires that you hold such pedestrian complaints in abeyance.
author: Brian Greene,  The Elegant Universe: Superstrings, Hidden Dimensions, and the Quest for the Ultimate Theory

quote: Science, you don't know, looks like magic.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: If I were not a physicist, I would probably be a musician. I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Science is the process that takes us from confusion to understanding...
author: Brian Greene

quote: An experiment is a question which science poses to Nature and a measurement is the recording of Nature's answer.
author: Max Planck,  Scientific Autobiography and Other Papers

quote: Science is a first-rate piece of furniture for a man's upper chamber, if he has common sense on the ground floor.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

quote: Science is a careful investigation.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Science isn't just about blowing things up. Rather it's about blowing things up and knowing how you did it.
author: William Gurstelle

quote: In some sort of crude sense, which no vulgarity, no humor, no overstatement can quite extinguish, the physicists have known sin; and this is a knowledge which they cannot lose.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote: He needs "space"and "time,"as if this were physics and not a human relationship.
author: Kathryn Stockett,  The Help

quote: Science is the poetry of reality.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: Measuring Love The only scientist who can measure love is the onewho's in love with another scientist.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: The day science begins to study non-physical phenomena, it will make more progress in one decade than in all the previous centuries of its existence.
author: Nikola Tesla

quote: Science is not a collection of facts. Nor is science something that happens in the laboratory. Science happens in the head. It's a flight of imagination beyond the constraints of ordinary perception. Columbus chapter -The Virgin and the Mousetrap
author: Chet Raymo

quote: Science is the ultimate pornography, analytic activity whose main aim is to isolate objects or events from their contexts in time and space. This obsession with the specific activity of quantified functions is what science shares with pornography.
author: J.G. Ballard,  The Atrocity Exhibition

quote: Science is a bit like the joke about the drunk who is looking under a lamppost for a key that he has lost on the other side of the street, because that's where the light is. It has no other choice.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Scientific principles and laws do not lie on the surface of nature. They are hidden, and must be wrested from nature by an active and elaborate technique of inquiry.
author: John Dewey,  Reconstruction in Philosophy

quote: When asked about which scientist he'd like to meet, Neil deGrasse Tyson said, "Isaac Newton. No question about it. The smartest person ever to walk the face of this earth. The man was connected to the universe in spooky ways. He discovered the laws of motion, the laws of gravity, the laws of optics. Then he turned 26.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: The laws of physics is the canvas God laid down on which to paint his masterpiece
author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons

quote: The steam engine has done much more for science than science has done for the steam engine.
author: William Thomson, 1st Baron Kelvin

quote: Gravity always wins
author: Michael Hirsch

quote: Ask a true scientist a very profound question on his science, and he will besilent. Ask a true religious person a very simple question on his religion, and he will be frenzied.
author: Kedar Joshi

quote: According to the Law of Attraction, the physical reality that you experience at present is drawn towards the future probability you desired when it attains more power.
author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

quote: When you concentrate your energy purposely on the future possibility that you aspire to realize, your energy is passed on to it and makes it attracted to you with a force stronger than the one you directed towards it.
author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

quote: The scientist is not a person who gives the right answers, he's one who asks the right questions.
author: Claude Lévi-Strauss

quote: Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer; art is everything else.
author: Donald Ervin Knuth,  Things a Computer Scientist Rarely Talks About

quote: Science is what you know, philosophy is what you don't know
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Give me the positions and velocities of all the particles in the universe, and I will predict the future.
author: Marquis Pierre Simon de Laplace

quote: Scissor, Paper, Rock [10w] When time acts like a scissor,react like a rock.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer. Art is everything else we do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Magic's just science that we don't understand yet.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: I was like I was in science class: I was curious.
author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones

quote: Standing in the middle between the idea of an event and the actual event, a strange kind of physical reality just in the middle between possibility and reality.
author: Heisenberg

quote: The highest court is in the end one’s own conscience and conviction—that goes for you and for Einstein and every other physicist—and before any science there is first of all belief.
author: Max Planck,  The Dilemmas of an Upright Man: Max Planck and the Fortunes of German Science

quote: In the world of the very small, where particle and wave aspects of reality are equally significant, things do not behave in any way that we can understand from our experience of the everyday world...all pictures are false, and there is no physical analogy we can make to understand what goes on inside atoms. Atoms behave like atoms, nothing else.
author: John Gribbin,  In Search of Schrödinger's Cat: Quantum Physics and Reality

quote: Man masters nature not by force, but by understanding
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Science is spectral analysis. Art is light synthesis.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: The important thing in science is not so much to obtain new facts as to discover new ways of thinking about them
author: William Lawrence Bragg

quote: Science is a way to call the bluff of those who only pretend to knowledge. It is a bulwark against mysticism, against superstition, against religion misapplied to where it has no business being.
author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

quote: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
author: Jules Verne,  A Journey to the Center of the Earth

quote: Laws of nature have no physical properties of mass /energy. They are platonic truths in transcendent realm that create & govern the Universe.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: Measure what can be measured, and make measurable what cannot be measured.
author: Galileo Galilei
